intro: Higginsia, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plants are shrubs or small trees, often characterized by their showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Higginsia species typically have rough, fissured bark and produce capsules as their fruiting bodies. They are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance and resilience to harsh conditions.
